IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF TALLAPOOSA COUNTY, ALABAMA
AT ALEXANDER CITY
CHRISTOPHER BLAINE MCGREGOR )
PLAINTIFF/RESPONDENT )
)
VS. ) CASE NO. DR-2023-900051.01
)
BRITTANY MICHELLE GILLILAND )
DEFENDANT/PETITIONER )
MOTION TO AMEND MOTION TO SUSPEND WEEKLY DINNERS
AND FOR CONTEMPT AND TO MODIFY PREVIOUS ORDER
Comes now the Plaintiff/Father, Christopher Blaine McGregor, by and through his
attorney of record, Dianne James Davis, and files this Motion to Amend Motion to Suspend
Weekly Dinners and for Contempt and to Modify Previous Order, and would further show the
Court the following:
1) That at the last hearing on July 31, 2024, after speaking with the minor child,
A.K., in chambers and on the bench, the Court stated that reunification therapy
would begin after the child attended individual and joint counseling sessions with
the Mother. (See p. 26, ll. 20-23; p. 28, ll. 8-11, 14-19; p. 29, ll. 11-25; p. 30, ll.
1-6, of the court transcript attached as Exhibit A.)
2) That the Order dated November 6, 2024, did not reflect the true wishes and order
of the Court
3) That the Father is unskilled in matters of the law and has had to hire the services
of an attorney to file this amendment. The Father was caused to incur legal
expenses and requests that the Mother be ordered to pay his attorney fees.
Wherefore, the premises considered, the Plaintiff/Father respectfully requests that the
reunification therapy be suspended pending completion of the minor child, A.K.’s, individual
and joint counseling sessions with the Defendant/Mother. The Plaintiff/Father further requests
that the Order dated November 6, 2024, be modified to reflect the wishes of the Court. The
Plaintiff/Father requests that the Defendant/Mother be ordered to pay his attorney fees and for
any and all such other relief to which he may be entitled, the premises considered.
DOCUMENT 134
Respectfully submitted on this the 11th day of February, 2025.
/s/Dianne James Davis
Dianne James Davis (DAV007)
Attorney for Plaintiff/Father
107 Main Street
Alexander City, Alabama 35010
